description.narrative:
Despite represent 60 to 65% of the population, Mali has no youth policy on how it will ensure that young people are systematically taken into account in national development plans or their obligations and specific civil rights are supported. In Mali, theprocess of developing such a policy for youth by youth themselves can help to promote active citizenship of young people and create opportunities for dialogue between young people and decision-makers directly. The AU has a Youth Charter that could be a good starting point for a youth policy in Mali. At present, Mali has no formal spaces for dialogue or young political consultation, though there are active youth councils that could be supported to increase their advocacy to reach decisions' makers. Thanksto their skills, energy and creativity, young people have the potential to transform power relations and build inclusive and sustainable societies.
This project seeks to mobilize young people of Mali, to work with young people and their organizations toeliminate barriers that deprive them of their rights, to participate fully in the development of their society and a voice so effective in the process of decision making especially in the fields of active citizenship and employment.

participating-org.narrative: Association des Jeunes pour la Cito Active et la Démocratie Mali

Youth led organisation (AJCAD) is created and recognized by Malian authority on March, 15 2014 under the registration N° 0374. Thisassociation is created by convinced young people about the key roles youth can play in development and human rights restoration in Mali. The fonders are young activists strongly involved in several youth related activities such as: reproductive health, good governance, advocacy, human rights etc.... After multiple activities implemented with Oxfam-Novib on the program entitled My Rights My Voice (M.R.M.V), young people have discovered their responsibilities. In 2013 the AJCAD organised during presidential and parliamentary elections a space of discussion among candidates. They also sensitized Malian to enrol on electoral list and go to poll. They alsosubmitted to candidate a manifesto in order to analyse their program for population well being. Based on the impact of these activities undertaken on community, youth and specially on women, the youth led organisation has decided to standardize it in term of sustainability and efficiency for people well being. Their goal is to bring changes in following fields/areas: # Promoting leadership among youths, # Participate in the development, monitoring and evaluation of youth policies in Mali; # Strengthen the capacity of youth # Cultivating the spirit of citizenship among young people; # Inform and educate the population on sexual and reproductive health. # Promote quality of education, active citizenship and good governance accountable; # Promoting youth Human rights
AJCAD is a member of the National Youth Movement Network and headed by a lady. Keen to gender balance, AJCAD steering committee is composed of four women and four men.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation
